content.rendered:
Frozen Cassava (frozen manioc, tapioca, yucca) as well as products from cassava is one of 13 key products of Vietnam to export in 2019.

Cassava Farm

During the Vietnam War, Cassava was used as food so it was grown everywhere. Today when rice becomes the main food, cassava become commodities. so the scale of growing Cassava is more, and the application of science and technology to agriculture, the quality and yield of Cassava increase dramatically, they are processed into many different products.

Economic value of cassava

    • Produce starch, dry/frozen cassava chips, crushed cassava flour
    • Produce a wide range of industrial products such as monosodium glutamate, alcohol, instant noodles, glucose, syrup, confectionery, malt, adhesive industry (litchi, wood paste), vermicelli, vermicelli, pasta, pasta, potato flour, rice paper, pearl seed (tapioca), food additives, pharmaceutical additives.
      • Produce animal feed.
    • Young cassava leaves are made frozen cassava leaves (below figure) used as vegetables

Frozen cassava leaves ball

Cassava export data

In 2017, cassava and products from cassava export to China reached 76.3 thousand tons.
In 2018, the amount of cassava and cassava products exported from Vietnam to reduce, but export to Korea increased by 203.5% in volume and increased by 401.5% in value compared to August 2017, reaching 20.06 thousand ton.

Other markets such as Europe, America, Australia and New Zealand are slight increase.

The Frozen Cassava production process

The best time to harvest Cassava is about 8-11 months after plating. After harvesting, cassava is transported immediately to store, avoiding long-term sun exposure in the fields and reducing the quality. Farmers cut tubers out of the tree, selected good cassava roots, standard size and moved to the factory.

Fresh cassava tubers

In factory, cassava tubers are recruited and then washed with a automatic machine.

cassava washing by machine

Cassava tubers washed

Tubers will be peeled and washed several times. Depending on the requirements of customers, cassava tubers are cut, sliced ​​or cut into cubes

Cassava peeled

After peeling, they are soaked in to reduce cyanide content and washed several times with water.

Peeled cassava are soaking and washing

The cut tubes are frozen directly or packed, vacuum and frozen

Frozen cassava cut

Frozen cassava cut are packed in plastic

The Frozen Cassava have a shelf life of 24 months, if they are stored at -18 degrees Celsius

Cassava roots is a nutritious food, in addition to boiled or steamed cassava, frozen grated cassava is used to make many cakes. In cassava contains a high fiber content to help us have a long feeling of fullness, suppressing appetite is very effective for those who want to lose weight.
